page.title: 17Place-names,High Lorton area
page.content:
The names of{places}in this block are almost all of{Norse}origin,dating back to the{Vikings}who settled here about a thousand years ago. {Fell}= mountain,e.g.Kirk F.,Todd F. {Gill}= ravine,e.g.Scaw G.,Sware G. {Beck}= stream,e.g.Aiken B.,Blaze B. {Force}= waterfall,e.g.Spout Force. {Hause}= pass,e.g.Widow Hause. { Scales}= shelter,e.g.Scales Farm. { Whin}= gorse,e.g.Whinlatter. { How}= hill,e.g.Darling H.,Brown H. { Mire}= marsh,e.g.Hole Mire. { Side}= high pasture,e.g.High Side. {Wythe}= willow,e.g.Wythop,Wythe Gill {Thwaite}= clearing,e.g.Thornthwaite.
These are just a few Norse names from this area,but there are many more throughout the Lake District.A lot of houses have such words in their names, so maintaining the Viking connection.
